narrative.title: 11-ex-1 â€” Rail Window Vistas
paragraphs: The ride afforded time to observe the lands of the Fall. The scenery shifted, yet the sickly sky held. On the horizon, a false dawn burned violet. Farther on, a pile-studded plain fell away and the track bent into trees that has little resemblance to home, their limbs weaving a tunnel. A winding bridge carried them over a river where strangers drifted on a raft.

examples: The window afforded a view of the sea.
The break afforded us time to rest.
We observed the ants at work.
Please observe how she solves the problem.

vocabulary.definition: the natural features of a place (what you see).
examples: Mountain scenery can be calming.
The train ride had lovely scenery.

vocabulary.definition: where the earth/sea seems to meet the sky.
examples: The sun dipped below the horizon.
Storm clouds gathered on the horizon.
The sky turned violet at dusk.
She wore a violet scarf.
A pile of books blocked the door.
Leaves lay in piles on the lawn.
The tracks curved into a tunnel.
Runners stayed in their lanes on the track.
The twins had a strong resemblance.
This copy bears little resemblance to the original.

vocabulary.definition: a passage dug through earth or rock.
examples: The road goes through a tunnel.
The kids built a snow tunnel.
A winding road climbed the hill.
The winding river glittered in the sun.

vocabulary.definition: the time when the sun first appears in the morning.
examples: Birds began to sing at dawn.
We started our hike at dawn.

vocabulary.definition: covered or dotted with many small pieces of something.
examples: A sky studded with stars.
A path studded with stones slowed our walk.

events.text: The ride gave them time to watch the strange land.
A sickly sky stayed the same even as views changed.
A distant glow colored the edge of the world.
The train curved into trees that arched overhead.
A bridge crossed a river where unknown travelers drifted.
